alert.note: Alert for Saipan; Tinian (Marianas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Warning issued January 20 at 11:18PM ChST until January 21 at 6:00AM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CHST SUNDAY... ...HIGH RISK OF RIP CURRENTS THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM SUNDAY TO 6 AM CHST MONDAY... * WHAT...For the High Surf Warning, dangerously large breaking waves of 14 to 18 feet in the surf zone. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 8 to 12 feet expected in the surf zone. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...North and east facing reefs of Tinian and Saipan. * WHEN...For the High Surf Warning, until 6 AM ChST Sunday. For the High Surf Advisory, from 6 AM Sunday to 6 AM ChST Monday. For the High Rip Current Risk, through late Sunday night. * IMPACTS...Breaking waves can sweep people off jetties and docks, and into dangerous seas. Life-threatening swimming conditions and significant beach erosion can be expected. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A new pulse of energy has raised wave heights enough to produce dangerous surf once again. It is expected to be short-lived, just several hours.
info.instruction: Everyone should remain out of the water due to life-threatening surf conditions. Stay off of jetties, piers, and other waterside infrastructure. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
